full_text: It has been the honor of my lifetime to represent the American people as the 71st Secretary of State. Thank you. https://t.co/VSjhNTRGpu

Thirty-two years ago, I began my career in government at @StateDept. While we face a more complex and contested world than when I started, I have seen time again that the incredible people at State will always meet the challenge. I am so proud to have worked alongside you. https://t.co/q3eZdUk7TU

RT @POTUS: Following the ceasefire, hostages are starting to be released.

Three Israeli women held for 470 days.
Four more women in seven…
In the past 4 years, I traveled to 86 countries and met with countless allies, partners, and leaders of every kind on behalf of the American people. https://t.co/QYIs0ZfTPh

Music is one of our greatest connectors, a common language for the world. I was proud to launch @StateDept's Global Music Diplomacy Initiative, which uses music and U.S. diplomacy to build bridges and foster collaboration between America and the world. https://t.co/n3ZtkT0m9H

In my first major speech, I laid out how we would leverage American diplomacy to safeguard and accelerate America’s renewal. Four years later, I can confidently say we delivered on that plan and have put the United States in a stronger place to deliver for the American people. https://t.co/UkwNNJNpuQ
With the help of steadfast American leadership, Ukraine will continue to stand as an independent, democratic nation with the freedom to choose its own future. https://t.co/5tioBrlKWC

After 15 months of conflict, we have brokered a deal based on the plan @POTUS proposed in May that will bring hostages home, stop the fighting, surge humanitarian aid to the people of Gaza, and create space to forge a permanent ceasefire. https://t.co/yMaWfjB5Wz

Synthetic drugs like fentanyl are the #1 killer of Americans aged 18-45. The U.S. launched a Global Coalition to address synthetic drug threats, disrupt supply chains, and detect emerging threats. I'm proud of the lives saved by the Coalition's work and America's leadership. https://t.co/qeYx14HnwU

On National Religious Freedom Day, as on every day, the United States remains steadfast in its centuries-long commitment to protect the freedom of religion or belief for all, both at home and around the globe.
RT @POTUS: Today, after many months of intensive diplomacy by the United States, along with Egypt and Qatar, Israel and Hamas have reached…

Today Foreign Minister @AraratMirzoyan and I launched the U.S.-Armenia Strategic Partnership Commission to intensify cooperation on mutual interests. It’s through our strong partnerships that we can help build lasting regional security and prosperity. https://t.co/sW1VQ0D5xf

English is our best export. @StateDept supports English language programs in places like the Domenico Americano School where students are learning English to open new doors and create even greater opportunities for themselves. 

https://t.co/aR7MUmpO8n https://t.co/mBLKSLnkbV

The post-conflict plan we've been working on with our partners would allow Israel to fully withdraw from Gaza, prevent Hamas from filling back in, and provide for Gaza's governance, security, and reconstruction. I shared some of its core elements today at the @AtlanticCouncil. https://t.co/FofDb9ADxD

When people ask about the best part of being Secretary of State, I say it’s meeting people from around the world. They are passionate, dedicated, and have made lasting impressions on me and the work I’ve done. Now I’d like to share their stories with you.
https://t.co/ITW9S1OBNI

Took a moment to look back at pictures from my time as Secretary. 

This one was from after @POTUS and I met with the NATO Secretary General. Under @POTUS' leadership, we've reengaged in @NATO and brought countries together to deter war and promote peace. https://t.co/aR7MUmqlXV https://t.co/KASNBmfit0

.@POTUS has never wavered in the conviction that when America leads and engages, there is little we cannot accomplish.

Mr. President, it has been the privilege of my lifetime to work for you, with you, and with this extraordinary team you've assembled. https://t.co/aO3nlbCP46

I’ve traveled over a million miles in this role and everywhere I’ve gone, I’ve heard from people with a strong desire to work together with the United States. Because of the work we’ve done to bring countries together, we’ve advanced progress for people in America and around the https://t.co/84ktK5j8Pe

The Venezuelan people and world know that Nicolas Maduro clearly lost the 2024 presidential election and has no right to claim the presidency today. We stand ready to support a return to democracy in Venezuela.
In Rome, I met with my counterparts from France, Italy, the UK, and Germany on helping the Syrian people seize this opportunity to build a better future. https://t.co/sJ79MDA68m

The United States congratulates the people of Lebanon on the historic election of President Joseph Aoun. We deeply value our long-standing partnership and are committed to working closely with President Aoun to secure a prosperous future for Lebanon.

Thank you President Macron and the people of France for the deep friendship you’ve extended to me over the years. It’s been an honor to have helped strengthen the historic alliance between the United States and France and to receive the Légion d’honneur. https://t.co/dbmuTF7qpc

As part of our continued surge in security assistance for Ukraine, we are now providing $500 million in weapons and equipment under previous drawdowns for Ukraine’s self-defense. The United States and more than 50 nations stand united with Ukraine.

Under @POTUS and @EmmanuelMacron's leaderships, the U.S. and France have confronted an increasingly complex world together and produced real results for our people and those around the world.

President Macron, thank you for your leadership, your partnership, and your friendship. https://t.co/MERZYmC9Yd

The partnership between the U.S. and France is producing results that matter and making a difference in the lives of our people. The challenges we face demand our engagement. When our countries work together, there is nothing we can’t accomplish. https://t.co/6ZQWw3Nig2

It's no accident I went to Japan on my very first trip as Secretary of State. I've gone back 7 times since and in the last four years, we've grown our alliance to be stronger than ever. https://t.co/2ncYfnrNr5

We have renewed the memorandum of understanding with @afghanevac, continuing our vital partnership to relocate and resettle Afghan allies who stood beside the United States for over 20 years. The U.S. remains committed to our pledge to always stand with our partners.

After reviewing the horrifying information of suffering inside Sudan, I have concluded that members of the Rapid Support Forces and allied militias have committed genocide in Sudan. The United States is committed to pursuing accountability for these atrocities.

As Secretary, I’ve seen the U.S.-Japan relationship evolve from focusing on bilateral issues to addressing global challenges. 

Thank you to Chief Cabinet Secretary Hayashi, Foreign Minister Iwaya, and my other Japanese colleagues for making our countries a force for progress. https://t.co/0WUiVqHM07

In the past four years, we’ve worked to develop the U.S.-Japan relationship into a true global partnership.

Today, Japan’s Prime Minister Shigeru and I spoke about how our countries will now be able to build on that foundation to advance progress for our people and the world. https://t.co/uMC0ThqWP6

Four years ago, I traveled to Seoul for my first overseas trip as Secretary of State. For my last trip, I’ve returned to Seoul to underscore the deep commitment the United States has to our relationship with the Republic of Korea. https://t.co/8prRZJaFuC

Met with Republic of Korea @FMChoTaeyul. We discussed bilateral issues such as the DPRK and Russia’s aggression against Ukraine. The Alliance is a linchpin for peace and prosperity for the Indo-Pacific. https://t.co/9O10aIkpqB

I met with ROK National Assembly Speaker Woo Won-shik to emphasize the United States’ support for the ROK and its people. Our commitment to the Alliance is ironclad. We also discussed ways to strengthen trilateral cooperation with Japan to address regional and global challenges. https://t.co/9RPItPju2j

In my meeting with Republic of Korea Acting President Choi Sang-mok, I reiterated U.S. confidence in the enduring strength of the U.S.-ROK Alliance. Our alliance is the linchpin of peace and security in the Indo Pacific and our support for the ROK and its people is enduring. https://t.co/3zhu4AEtDy

At the beginning of each year, many of us pause to reflect on the previous year and then look ahead to what we hope to do with the next year we’re given. As we start anew, I wish the American people and our friends and partners around the world the very best in 2025.

As part of the surge in security assistance for Ukraine that President Biden announced on September, the United States is providing $1.25 billion in weapons and equipment today for Ukraine’s self-defense. The United States and more than 50 nations stand united with Ukraine.
President Carter showed us what could be achieved through tireless diplomacy and dedication to the pursuit of peace, democracy, and human rights. https://t.co/W6IOXZ5rjx
Warm wishes to all celebrating Kwanzaa! May the light of the Kinara bring unity, reflection, and appreciation for the blessings of family and community. Habari Gani!
Happy Hanukkah! May this festival bring hope and light to you and your loved ones. Chag Sameach.
Wishing everyone a Merry Christmas! May your day be filled with joy, peace, and cherished moments with loved ones.

It has been my joy and privilege to present @StateDept’s @Toysfortots_USA donation to the @USMC every year for the past four years.

Thank you to our longstanding partners at @USMC for always working with us to give more and to do all we can to care for others. https://t.co/zdtwDX6CS8

At any given time around the world there are @StateDept professionals who are on assignment without their loved ones. They sacrifice time with those they care about, even over the holidays, to do the necessary work of diplomacy. We are so grateful to them and their families for https://t.co/pVdNbbiC6X

For people across the globe, America is embodied by the music, art, and films made by this year’s Kennedy Center honorees. Through their creative work, they are showing millions of people who we are, what we stand for, and what we can be. https://t.co/wgsSl7SmdL

It’s been two years since Taliban banned women and girls from universities and Afghan women from working in NGOs. Afghan women and girls are the lynchpin to a more stable, peaceful, and prosperous Afghanistan. We call on the Taliban to immediately reverse these edicts.

By setting rules of the road for AI, we can minimize the risks. We can harness the exceptional promise of this technology. Over the last few years, the United States has led international efforts toward these common goals. https://t.co/zmnjdvmj89

Sat down with @CFR_org President Michael Froman for an important conversation about how U.S. foreign policy and diplomacy strengthens our national security, enhances our economic competitiveness, and delivers for the American people. https://t.co/uzMAk2Ciqe

Today, the United States and our partners in the region agreed on a set of shared principles to guide our support for Syria as it transitions to a new government.

We are ready to support the Syrian people as they chart a new path forward. https://t.co/yvmQWj2mz3

At today’s Aqaba Meetings on Syria in Jordan, we talked about the need for an inclusive, Syrian-led political transition. The United States supports a future government in Syria that is chosen by and representative of all Syrians. https://t.co/F4XH4Wm1pp
Iraqi Prime Minister Sudani and I met to discuss the latest developments in Syria. I underscored our commitment to Iraq’s security, stability, and sovereignty. https://t.co/oK7f5vgATB

Turkish Foreign Minister @HakanFidan and I met to discuss the situation in Syria and the importance of a Syria-led and Syrian-owned transition. We also spoke about the need to protect the rights and freedoms of Syrians, including members of minorities, during this pivotal time. https://t.co/rSjmn4gk3i
The United States is providing an additional $500 million in weapons and equipment for Ukraine’s self-defense. The United States and more than 50 nations stand united in support of Ukraine.

Türkiye President @RTErdogan and I discussed regional security and the political transition in Syria today. The transition must be Syria-led, include all Syrians, protect civilian life, and allow for humanitarian aid to reach those who need it. https://t.co/ShNV2ycejI

For the first time in decades, Syria has an opportunity to have a government that is run by and answers to the people, not dominated by a dictator, religious or ethnic group, or outside power. We're determined to work closely with partners so Syrians can realize that aspiration. https://t.co/OCfouCEKCo

Met with Jordanian Foreign Minister @AymanHsafadi to discuss U.S. support for Jordan during the transition in Syria. We also spoke about the strength of the U.S.-Jordan strategic partnership and our efforts to secure peace in the region. https://t.co/tXYXYd2i3z

I met with @KingAbdullahII in Aqaba today to discuss developments in Syria and U.S. support for the stability of Jordan. We spoke about the importance of an inclusive transition to an accountable, representative government in Syria chosen by the Syrian people. https://t.co/ZIrkKmWKUh

The United States calls on Azerbaijan to end its intensifying crackdown on media and civil society. We urge Azerbaijan to respect its international human rights obligations and release those unjustly detained, including Rufat Safarov, Sevinj Vagifgizi, and others detained for

The U.S. condemns the Taliban's discriminatory edicts, which jeopardize the rights and lives of Afghan women and girls. Women’s full, equal, and meaningful participation in society is not merely a matter of equality; it is essential. We resolutely support Afghan women and girls.

.@JohnKerry prefers to get caught trying. He throws himself into causes that he believes in. Even when the odds are long. He taught us that trying is the only way for us to deliver on our nation's promise to the world.

With this portrait, John will continue to inspire the https://t.co/u0pEJVsuwm

For our 2024 Human Rights Defenders awardees advancing human rights is not a job, it is quite literally a lifelong mission. They make our country better, and they make the world better. They inspire me and I thank them for showing us the best of humanity every single day. https://t.co/uGRxNd1W66

The U.S. has introduced new visa restriction policies for individuals responsible for abusive or unjust detention abroad of foreign nationals and the family members of individuals who wrongfully detain Americans. Human beings should never be used as bargaining chips.

We stand with all human right defenders who fight against repression and advocate for fundamental freedoms. The U.S. and our partners will continue to work toward a world in which all nations uphold and strive toward the principal that human rights belong to everyone, everywhere.

Last week, I attended my last NATO meeting as Secretary of State and I took a moment to reflect on why NATO came together in the first place.

For 75 years, we've seen time and time again that a stronger NATO is the best way to prevent war. Our Alliance provides people with the https://t.co/5e97hV9duY

Today I recognized 10 remarkable individuals for their extraordinary contributions in the fight against corruption, a threat which poses profound and far reaching challenges to all of our societies. We are all better for their extraordinary work and partnership in this fight. https://t.co/GpZ8euaNjQ

After 14 years of conflict, the Syrian people finally have reason for hope. The United States strongly supports a peaceful transition of power to an accountable Syrian government through an inclusive Syrian-led process.

I met with human rights activists to discuss Russia’s abuses in Ukraine and concerns over crackdowns on civil society and media, political prisoners, and spreading “foreign agent” laws in the OSCE region. We must stand strong against repression and defend human rights. https://t.co/GUauk6Oq1u

I met with Israel’s Foreign Minister @gidonsaar today in Malta. During our conversation I emphasized the importance of ending the war in Gaza, returning home all hostages, and providing lasting peace and security for Israelis and Palestinians alike. https://t.co/Di7jhb2MjT

Time and time again, @OSCE has demonstrated the value of diplomacy in the face of Russian obstructionism. We must enable the OSCE to continue its critical work of advancing peace, defusing conflict, battling corruption, and supporting democracy. https://t.co/hYuOdNKlPp
I am honored to receive Sweden’s Royal Order of the Polar Star alongside my friend @jensstoltenberg. With Sweden as an Ally, NATO is stronger and more united than ever. https://t.co/emujlgtPXX

Today I met with our small but mighty @usembmalta team and their families. Thank you for the work you do each day to strengthen U.S.-Malta ties, foster economic growth, and build lasting friendships with the Maltese people. https://t.co/qCyBa76ARe

I met with Maltese Prime Minister @RobertAbela_MT during the OSCE Ministerial in Malta. I commend Malta’s principled leadership as 2024 OSCE Chair-in-Office and as an elected member of the UN Security Council. We reaffirmed the enduring U.S.-Maltese partnership. https://t.co/aNsBZ9jadd

Spoke with Romanian Foreign Minister @Odobes1Luminita on the margins of NATO about our strong cooperation, including our support to Ukraine and Moldova. I commended Romania’s security and energy leadership and underscored our shared values of democracy and fundamental freedoms.

Since Russia’s invasion, @NATO has been clear: a strong, independent, democratic Ukraine is vital for Euro-Atlantic security. During meetings at the @NATO Foreign Ministerial, we continued coordination to ensure Ukraine has what it needs to defend its future. https://t.co/SAk8dgQVYz

We remain fully committed to our collective defense and to defending our future for generations to come.

We are NATO. https://t.co/4OWuh6A20E

During my meeting with German Foreign Minister @ABaerbock today, we discussed the importance of continued support for Ukraine and underscored the need for an end to the war in Gaza and release of all hostages.
I met with Ukrainian Foreign Minister @andrii_sybiha to underscore U.S support of Ukraine’s irreversible path to NATO and its defense against Russia’s war of aggression. https://t.co/ZsSvwLBK1K

During our first session of this week's NATO Foreign Ministers’ Meeting, I spoke with our closest Allies and partners about our support for Ukraine and our unwavering commitment to our collective defense. https://t.co/EERkmqYRNE

Maintaining peace in NATO’s northern flank demands robust defense against diverse threats. Close coordination is essential. At today’s @NATO Arctic Allies meeting, Sweden and Finland showcased their high north expertise. Grateful to @MelanieJoly for hosting. https://t.co/ap9UMCuN6P

Met with @SecGenNATO Rutte ahead of the @NATO Foreign Ministers Meeting to discuss Alliance priorities, including our unwavering support to Ukraine against Russia’s aggression and the importance of strengthening NATO’s cooperation with southern partners. https://t.co/sueORO3hF9

The U.S. is committed to amplifying the leadership of persons with disabilities in everything we do. For International Day of Persons with Disabilities and beyond, we will continue to advance disability rights and inclusion as an imperative to a secure and more prosperous world.
Today, I am announcing the delivery of $725 million in additional weapons and equipment for Ukraine’s defense. The United States and more than 50 nations stand united with Ukraine.

The United States congratulates incoming European Council President @antoniolscosta, as well as @vonderleyen, @kajakallas, and the new @EU_Commission. Our close collaboration advances mutual prosperity and democratic values.

.@StateDept through @PEPFAR and its partners have changed the HIV/AIDS pandemic’s trajectory, saving 26 million lives across in 55 countries. On World AIDS Day, I am #ProudofPEPFAR as we continue working to sustain gains and accelerate progress against HIV/AIDS.

As we gather for Thanksgiving, I’m thinking of all our State Department teams around the world, many of whom have made personal sacrifices to serve our country. I’m proud of the work you do and grateful to serve alongside you. Wishing everyone a Happy Thanksgiving.

Spoke to Mark Swidan, Kai Li, and John Leung as they traveled home to the United States just in time for Thanksgiving. I told them how glad I was that they were in good health and that they’ll soon be reunited with their loved ones. https://t.co/AoL0UrCdO4

In Rome, we have three diplomatic missions working together to advance our relationships with Italy, the World Food Program, and the Holy See. I am so immensely proud of our Tri-Mission and everything they’re doing to strengthen these key partnerships on behalf of our country. https://t.co/gzXfZwREF6
Met with Pope Francis today to express gratitude for his global leadership in protecting the most vulnerable and promoting human dignity. https://t.co/gpLeAKGhlX

Met with Holy See officials Cardinal Parolin and Archbishop Gallagher and affirmed close U.S.-Holy See partnership on addressing key priorities. We discussed the Middle East and Sudan, support for Ukraine’s sovereignty, and promoting democracy in Venezuela. https://t.co/oISrDvmqTp

As my final G7 as Secretary of State, I want to thank all of my counterparts in the G7 who've been remarkable colleagues and good friends. The last four years have shown that we can navigate an increasingly complex world much more effectively together. https://t.co/lJM1SVEQby

The U.S. and India are stronger when we are working together. Indian External Affairs Minister @DrSJaishankar and I met today in Italy to discuss the importance of our continued close cooperation to promote global security and prosperity. https://t.co/w21GHlM9W3

We are working with our Euro-Atlantic and Indo-Pacific allies to address global security challenges, including PRC and DPRK support for Russia. Together, we’re bolstering a free and open Indo-Pacific across the Taiwan Strait, on the Korean Peninsula, and in the South China Sea. https://t.co/73zF6S0gWj

RT @POTUS: Today, I have good news to report from the Middle East.  
 
I have spoken to the Prime Ministers of Lebanon and Israel. And I am…

I congratulated Italian Foreign Minister @Antonio_Tajani for Italy's successful G7 host year. As a close partner and ally, we also discussed shared concerns about humanitarian aid to Gaza and Lebanon, support for Ukraine, and the implications of Russia bringing DPRK into its war.
The United States and the G7 remain unwavering in our support of Ukraine’s sovereignty and territorial integrity. https://t.co/K8dWZXcdkS

Around the world, the World Food Program is working to deliver life-saving aid to millions of people. While in Rome, I had the opportunity to meet with WFP staff to get an update on their work and how the U.S. can continue working with them to expand humanitarian access. https://t.co/i0DMxVor5x
G7 members stand together with an enduring commitment to global security, stability, and democracy. https://t.co/Z8aGQ3hQD9

Today, we remember the Holodomor, Stalin’s intentional famine that killed millions of Ukrainians. We reaffirm our support for Ukraine’s sovereignty and territorial integrity as it defends its freedom against Russia’s aggression.

Visited our team at the passport processing center in DC to see the remarkable work they are doing to get more blue books into the hands of Americans. I'm proud to say our team processed a record number of passports this year — over 24 million. https://t.co/ucOHao7KaH

I'm deeply grateful to all of the men and women of @StateDeptDSS and @OSACstate. Today, we talked about steps we're taking to further strengthen OSAC's ability to bolster collaboration between our government's security forces and private actors to keep Americans safe abroad. https://t.co/T6DOjP17Xy

I met with Turkish Foreign Minister @HakanFidan at G20 to speak about efforts for a diplomatic resolution in Lebanon that implements UNSC 1701 and an end to the war in Gaza that secures the release of hostages. We also discussed the need for a durable peace in the South Caucasus.
The Venezuelan people spoke resoundingly on July 28 and made @EdmundoGU the president-elect. Democracy demands respect for the will of the voters.

Great to connect with our team from the U.S. Consulate General in Rio de Janeiro who have played a critical role in bringing this week's G20 to life. Everyday, they do terrific work to keep our friendship with the people of Brazil and our partnership with the government of Brazil https://t.co/8lAW1Avvki

Productive discussion with counterparts from Canada, Chile, France, Italy, Mexico, Paraguay, Spain, the UK, and Uruguay at @G20org. I urged partners to advance peace and security in Haiti and support democracy and transparency in Venezuela.

Met with Egyptian Foreign Minister Badr Abdelatty in Rio today on the margins of the G20 Leaders' Summit. We talked about the situation in the Middle East, efforts to bring the conflicts on Gaza and Lebanon to an end, and the need to release all hostages.

Met with Saudi Foreign Minister Prince @faisalbinfarhan in Rio on the margins of the G20 Ministerial to discuss efforts to bring the conflicts in Gaza and Lebanon to an end, return hostages home, and increase humanitarian assistance.

Today we announced that the United States will support the city of Lima in building a new passenger train line that will expand access to reliable and affordable transportation for over 200,000 people every single day. https://t.co/h1TGSHxriA

For 30 years, APEC has brought together government and business leaders across the Asia-Pacific. Today, I thanked those leaders and called on them to stay engaged. By partnering together, we can build more inclusive economies with greater opportunity for all our people. https://t.co/31lrHmtZBV
Met with Lin Hsin-i in Lima. We spoke about our growing economic relationship and our enduring shared commitment to foster an open, dynamic, and peaceful Indo-Pacific. https://t.co/KH0hVTzFrI

Met with Canada's Foreign Affairs Minister @melaniejoly to discuss several global and hemispheric issues of importance to our relationship and strategic partnership, including Haiti, the conflict in the Middle East, Arctic security, and modernizing the Columbia River Treaty. https://t.co/O5Y2yPegpT

Good to see @MofaJapan_en Foreign Minister Iwaya Takeshi in Peru on the margins of APEC. Through the U.S.-Japan Alliance, U.S.-Japan-ROK trilateral cooperation, and other fora, we're working together to promote peace, prosperity, and security in the Indo-Pacific and around the https://t.co/opupkUr1JS

Today on the margins of APEC, I met with Republic of Korea Foreign Minister @FMChoTaeyul to reaffirm the strength of the U.S.-ROK alliance and discuss the importance of engagement in the region and beyond. https://t.co/ZIH5KL2kgg

Strong economic ties with the Asia-Pacific are key to global economic growth. At the APEC Ministerial Meeting, I reaffirmed our commitment to working with fellow member economies to continue our trade, investment, and sustainable and inclusive economic cooperation efforts across https://t.co/SdqEc70URx

I’m back in Brussels for discussions with our partners and allies on how we can ensure Ukraine has what it needs to effectively defend itself.

Together, with more than 50 countries, the U.S. is working to actively support Ukraine and its fight for freedom. https://t.co/Kylqq1BkaZ

Met with UK Foreign Secretary @DavidLammy to discuss defending Ukraine against Russia's aggression. We also discussed efforts to end the war in Gaza, secure the release of all hostages, and surge humanitarian assistance. https://t.co/004rGDgD9I

Great opportunity to reengage with High Representative for Foreign Affairs and Vice President-Designate Kallas here in Brussels on issues that matter the most – global peace, security, and stability achieved by a strong transatlantic partnership. https://t.co/3k6a2u1aQ1

Met with EU High Representative @JosepBorrellF to affirm the strength of our transatlantic partnership and discuss countering Russia’s aggression against Ukraine and strengthening global peace and stability. https://t.co/LPXJUfWzvj

Today I met with Foreign Minister @andrii_sybiha, reaffirming U.S. support for Ukraine in its fight against Russia's aggression and for its irreversible path to full Euro-Atlantic integration, including NATO membership. https://t.co/ZbQwe8FtIl

Met today with @SecGenNATO Rutte to underscore the longstanding partnership between the United States and NATO and reaffirm our support for Ukraine against Russia's aggression. https://t.co/EkW6qLtCZe

Welcomed Indonesian President @prabowo to the State Department ahead of his meeting tomorrow with President Biden. This visit is a testament to the strength of our nations' relationship and to our enduring commitment to implementing our Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. https://t.co/HfrgYRRkHD

On Veterans Day, we honor the men and women who have answered the call to serve and defend. Thank you for your bravery, your resolve, and for the sacrifices you and your families have made to ensure the security of our nation.

At U.S. embassies around the world, the first person you often see is a United States Marine.

On their 249th birthday, we at the @StateDept thank @USMC for their partnership and their work to protect our people, our embassies and consulates, and our diplomatic work everyday. https://t.co/rOBkMoQlbo

There is no place in our world for antisemitic attacks like those against Israeli soccer fans in Amsterdam yesterday. The United States stands with the Dutch and Israeli governments in strongly condemning these horrible acts of violence and antisemitism in all its forms.

When we incorporate the needs and the insights of people with disabilities, we all benefit from their talents, their expertise, and their leadership. That's why @StateDept is working to incorporate disability inclusion and perspectives into every aspect of our foreign policy. https://t.co/Bvcyhr2IIF

I am announcing $425 million in assistance under previous drawdowns in support of Ukraine’s defense. We will continue to surge security assistance to Ukraine and provide its forces the support they need for success on the battlefield.

It's so important that we have a @StateDept that is fit for purpose and ready to tackle the challenges of this time.

I'm proud of everything we've done over the last three years to implement the modernization agenda and make our diplomacy stronger for the American people. https://t.co/TnRI8V9t7R

Diwali is more than just a festival; it's a powerful reminder of the values we all cherish: patience, togetherness, kindness, and unity.

To all who celebrate, all over the world, and with us here in the U.S., I wish you a Diwali filled with joy, peace, and prosperity.

Our enduring alliance with the Republic of Korea is vital as we face growing DPRK provocations and geopolitical challenges. This morning, @SecDef Austin and I will welcome Foreign Minister Cho and Defense Minister Kim to the @StateDept to further our strategic partnership.

I met with Ukrainian Presidential Administration Head @AndriyYermak today to discuss U.S. military and economic assistance and ongoing diplomatic efforts in support of Ukraine. The United States continues our enduring support of Ukraine against Russia's ongoing aggression.

America is open for business, we're open for travel, and we're open for tourism. This year, we streamlined processes and issued more visas than ever before to bring in more travel and tourism to the U.S. and to support millions of American jobs in this industry. https://t.co/u3UJCW57EV

The Partnership for Atlantic Cooperation has put the ocean at the center of our Atlantic relationships. I thank Jessye Lapenn for her leadership, creativity, and dedicated public service and for underscoring our high-level commitment to the Atlantic community.

The Georgian people embraced democracy yesterday. Now Georgia’s political leaders must respect the rule of law, repeal legislation that undermines fundamental freedoms, address deficiencies in the electoral process, and move Georgia toward its Euro-Atlantic future.

When I met with UAE Foreign Minister @ABZayed, I commended him for the UAE’s humanitarian support for the people of Gaza and underscored the importance of our continued close cooperation to de-escalate tensions and shape a prosperous future for the region. https://t.co/DzlMTdHJOa

Met with Lebanese Caretaker Prime Minister Mikati and underscored U.S. support for the UN Interim Force in Lebanon and Lebanon’s political stability and humanitarian needs. A diplomatic resolution that implements UNSC 1701 is essential so displaced citizens can return home.

Met with Jordanian Foreign Minister @AymanHsafadi  today to discuss the urgency of bringing the war in Gaza to an end. I thanked Jordan for its leadership in providing desperately needed, life-saving humanitarian aid to Gaza through the Jordan Corridor. https://t.co/y6IpHEALOp

In his role as mediator, Qatari Prime Minister and Foreign Minister @MBA_AlThani_  has spared no effort to work to bring the hostages home. Today, we talked about how we can capitalize on this moment to end the conflict in Gaza and secure the release of all hostages. https://t.co/KSkH2Gh2za

While in Doha today, I announced more than $135 million in humanitarian assistance for Palestinians throughout the region. This new funding will assist WHO and UNICEF teams as they work to deliver life-saving humanitarian assistance in Gaza and where it is most needed.

In my meeting with Qatari Amir @TamimBinHamad, we discussed efforts to end the conflicts in Gaza and along the Blue Line. I thanked Qatar for its significant contributions to humanitarian efforts in Gaza and Lebanon and its essential role promoting regional peace. https://t.co/5KJl52006i

While in Riyadh, I had the chance to meet with our dedicated @USAinKSA team. At a critical time for the region, their tireless work to advance our goals and press for diplomatic solutions has been essential. https://t.co/d7eZtJ1Y2q

In 2024 our @travelgov team broke passport processing records for the third year in a row, issuing 24.5 million passports. Processing times are down and more than 1 million Americans have now used our online passport renewal system to renew entirely online.
The United States stands with our Ally Türkiye and strongly condemns today’s terrorist attack. My thoughts are with the victims and their families.

In my meeting with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, we spoke at great length about seizing this opportunity to end the war and ease suffering in Gaza. We also discussed efforts underway to achieve a diplomatic solution in Lebanon and end the conflict in Sudan. https://t.co/sDe2XHXpnM

I met with Saudi Foreign Minister Prince Faisal bin Farhan Al Saud to talk about our common efforts to end conflicts and establish stability in the Middle East. I thanked him for Saudi Arabia’s work to facilitate humanitarian relief into Gaza. https://t.co/d8eSF2oe6T

Israel has achieved important strategic objectives to ensure that October 7th can never happen again. Now is the time to end the war, get the hostages home, and chart a new path forward that enables the Palestinian people to rebuild their lives. https://t.co/ZS1VPmjb44

In my meetings with Israeli officials, I reiterated the importance of bringing home the hostages, getting humanitarian relief to those who need it, and ending the war in Gaza in a way that provides lasting security and stability. https://t.co/b9qHo8KkXr

Today @IsraeliPM Netanyahu and I talked about the importance of seizing this opportunity to end the conflict in Gaza, return all hostages, and chart a path to lasting peace and security for Israelis and Palestinians alike. https://t.co/FVaJYdtg8P

On my way to Israel and other stops in the Middle East for intensive discussions about the importance of ending the war in Gaza, returning the hostages to their families, and alleviating the suffering of the Palestinian people. https://t.co/lIaRUo7Ea2

Today I recognized six individuals doing admirable and inspiring work in their countries as 2024 Global Anti-Racism Champions. They are true defenders of human rights, working around the world to assist marginalized racial and ethnic groups. https://t.co/2aVnbRpY0C

Today, I am announcing a new $400 million assistance package in support for Ukraine’s defense. The United States and more than 50 nations stand united with Ukraine, and this support will ensure continued robust support in the months ahead.

Ambassador Tina Kaidanow was an extraordinary diplomat who led on some of the most challenging foreign policy issues of her time. She was an exceptional colleague and friend - deeply smart, funny, tenacious, and devoted to American diplomacy. May her memory be a blessing.

Congratulations to President Prabowo Subianto on his inauguration as president of Indonesia. We look forward to working with President Subianto as we build on 75 years of partnership between our two nations.
RT @POTUS: The United States will always stand with its friends – for peace, security, and prosperity. https://t.co/C04B1o9CDk
Great to be in Berlin to support @POTUS engagements with German leaders and further strengthen the close bond the United States and Germany share as Allies and friends.

Today, I am announcing the delivery of $425 million of support for Ukraine's defense. The United States and more than 50 nations stand united with Ukraine, and this support will ensure continued robust support in the months ahead.

Inspiring to hear about the work Lou, Catdy, and April are doing to address critical challenges and expand opportunities in their communities. They are among many young leaders doing great things in the region and represent the extraordinary potential of our @yseali network. https://t.co/jSKOE7G71q
As Jewish communities around the world observe Yom Kippur, I send my best wishes for an easy and meaningful fast. G’mar Chatimah Tovah.

Today we released an updated U.S. Global Strategy to Empower Adolescent Girls—an investment in our collective future. 
 
On the International Day of the Girl, we reaffirm our commitment through action to elevating the power, potential, and progress of girls and women everywhere.

Thanked our U.S. Embassy Vientiane and @USMission2ASEAN teams for their hard work to advance our relationships with the Lao People’s Democratic Republic and with ASEAN. Their efforts are moving our vital partnerships forward at a pivotal time. https://t.co/vC8mnWjII1

The East Asia Summit is a key forum for addressing pressing challenges, including the ongoing crisis in Burma and tensions in the South China Sea. Welcomed today’s discussion with leaders and partners on how we can work together to tackle these issues for a secure Indo-Pacific. https://t.co/bu58V4i2hG

ASEAN is central to a free and prosperous Southeast Asia, and it is at the heart of our Indo-Pacific Strategy. At the ASEAN-U.S. Summit in Vientiane, we discussed our robust economic engagement and intensifying cooperation in many areas, including the digital economy and AI. https://t.co/mZqEiEE2Mu

As a democratic leader in Southeast Asia, Malaysia plays a key role in promoting regional stability and prosperity. Thanked Prime Minister @anwaribrahim for Malaysia’s leadership and reaffirmed our commitment to deepening our Comprehensive Partnership and advancing shared goals. https://t.co/TuNtlDUE9v

Good to see Thai Prime Minister @ingshin and to reaffirm the importance of the U.S.-Thailand alliance. The U.S. is deeply appreciative of Thailand’s strong leadership within ASEAN, and we commend Thailand for its continued support in addressing the conflict in Burma. https://t.co/xNdWaMnuBy

On the anniversary of the October 7th attack on Israel, we mourn the loss of lives in the tragic terrorist attacks, including Americans. It’s time to reach a ceasefire that brings the hostages home, secures Israel, alleviates the suffering of the Palestinian people, and brings an

The U.S. is at the forefront of humanitarian response to the growing crisis in Lebanon, announcing nearly $157 million in assistance today. We are committed to supporting those in need and delivering essential aid to displaced civilians, refugees and the communities hosting them.

Met with Gabon’s Transition President @oliguinguema. The United States is looking forward to partnering with Gabon throughout the country’s transition to democracy and elevating our bilateral relationship across sectors, including development, environment, and security. https://t.co/WwN2XAX7hX

Today’s new agreement between Mauritius and the UK on the status of the Chagos Archipelago is a win for diplomacy. It secures the operational future of the joint military facility on Diego Garcia, reflecting our shared commitment to a secure and independent Indo-Pacific region.
Shanah Tovah to all who celebrate Rosh Hashanah. From my family to yours, may you have a happy, healthy, and sweet New Year.

With a fierce competition underway to define a new age in international affairs, we have pursued a strategy of renewal under this Administration, pairing historic investments in competitiveness at home with an intensive diplomatic campaign to revitalize partnerships abroad.

Met today with my colleague and friend Moroccan Foreign Minister Bourita to discuss the strong U.S.-Morocco strategic partnership and ways we can achieve shared security objectives in the region. https://t.co/LI0urte1EK

Congratulations to Claudia Sheinbaum on her historic inauguration as Mexico's first woman President. We look forward to working closely with President Sheinbaum to build on the strong U.S.-Mexico partnership as neighbors, partners, and friends.

Together, the U.S. and India are working to address regional and global challenges. Indian External Affairs Minister @DrSJaishankar and I met to discuss our continued cooperation on the climate crisis and ways we can promote regional security and prosperity. https://t.co/7SFa5z1yg9

The U.S.-Iraq strategic partnership is unshakeable. On the margins of today's D-ISIS Ministerial, Iraqi Minister of Foreign Affairs Dr. Fuad Hussein and I discussed diplomatic efforts to promote regional stability and to prevent escalation of conflicts in the region. https://t.co/TXCKre9maK

Refugees play a critical role in U.S. society and to our economic growth. Today @POTUS set the refugee admissions target at 125,000 for the next fiscal year. The United States will continue to be a global leader in providing safety and opportunity for the world’s most vulnerable.

Met with Norway’s Foreign Minister @EspenBarthEide to discuss advancing our partnership, enhancing support for Ukraine, and promoting stability in the Middle East. We also signed an agreement on secure, transparent critical mineral supply chains that protects workers. https://t.co/uW2sMHHrV9

Met with Kuwaiti Foreign Minister Al-Yahka today as we welcomed the beginning of the U.S.-Kuwait Strategic Dialogue. Kuwait is a longstanding and robust partner of our many shared goals. We reaffirmed our partnership to promote peace and regional stability. https://t.co/3N2FMcyUnd

My message to our D-ISIS Coalition partners 10 years into our fight: We can take pride in our accomplishments, but we must evolve as the challenge evolves. We must not let up in this moment, but recommit to our common mission to decisively defeat ISIS and protect our people. https://t.co/MhzLUGBxNU

We remember the Babyn Yar massacre on Sept 29 - 30, 1941, when 34,000 Jews were murdered by Nazis. Today, Russia falsely claims it’s “de-Nazifying” Ukraine by engaging in crimes against humanity in a country that was brutalized by both the Nazi and Soviet regimes.

Adherence to international law is critical for maritime safety and security in the Asia-Pacific. We reaffirmed this as an international coalition at today's @UN Ministerial on Maritime Safety and Security in the Asia-Pacific.

Met with Central Asian counterparts to discuss progress and enhanced cooperation on C5+1 platform goals. The United States is committed to working with nations in the region to advance our shared goals for an independent, prosperous, and secure Central Asia. https://t.co/zdpvunjrMH

Our health security is national security.

At the UNGA Ministerial on Global Health Security, we discussed the valuable work foreign ministries play in mobilizing political will, global resources and coordination efforts to address infectious disease threats and active outbreaks.

Today, I am directing the drawdown of $5.55 billion in remaining authority in support for Ukraine’s defense. The United States and more than 50 nations stand united with Ukraine, and this support will ensure continued robust support in the months ahead.
Today at UNGA, the U.S. stood united with our partners in support of the Venezuelan people and called for a return to democracy. The will of the people must be respected.

Joined Germany, France, and EU, African and Gulf partners to agree on urgent actions needed to end the war and the suffering of the Sudanese people. We called on warring parties to re-engage in negotiations, secure humanitarian access, and ensure protection of civilians.

The U.S. is sending a new drawdown package of urgently needed weapons and equipment to support Ukraine’s military as they defend against Russia’s ongoing attacks. This support helps Ukraine protect its troops and its people and reinforce its capabilities on the front lines.

I convened global leaders today to reiterate the need for greater contributions to help meet Haiti’s security, economic, and humanitarian needs. The U.S. is doing our part to help the Haitian people write the future they deserve by providing an additional $160 million in foreign https://t.co/5faXZWNKR3

At UNGA, I joined leaders from across the Americas to drive forward our collective efforts to respond to irregular migration and forced displacement. Together, we can address the unprecedented level of migration in our hemisphere and advance the goals of the LA Declaration. https://t.co/dsY4uSH2Wk

The misuse of synthetic drugs is a global challenge no country can solve alone.

Joined @POTUS at the Leaders’ Summit of the Global Coalition to Address Synthetic Drug Threats to discuss steps the U.S. and 159 countries are taking to protect our communities and end this crisis. https://t.co/fg9f0f4wwe
RT @POTUS: It was my pleasure sitting down with UN Secretary-General António Guterres to underscore how the U.S. and the United Nations are…

The Lobito Corridor connects the Democratic Republic of the Congo and Zambia to markets in Angola. At the @UN, we celebrated the progress of the Corridor in connecting Africa — a benefit to all our countries and economies for years to come. https://t.co/ekKsnk0AYb
Whether on the battlefield or at the @UN Security Council, the United States will continue to support Ukraine in its fight to defend itself against Russia’s aggression. https://t.co/e4KYwrtQaH

There will always be forces to pull our countries and world apart. As @POTUS outlined at UNGA today, our task is to make sure the forces holding us together are stronger than those pulling us apart. There is nothing beyond our capacity if we work together. https://t.co/QLiEoABSEe

On my way to watch @POTUS deliver remarks at the UN General Assembly in New York. When the president took office, he was determined to restore, rebuild and rejuvenate our alliances and partnerships. This week at UNGA, we are reminded of how he's done just that. https://t.co/evew8b1RJ4

The U.S. is excited about AI's potential for the future. In New York, I emphasized to leaders of AI companies that we want the benefits of safe, secure, and trustworthy AI to be shared equitably across the globe–and we are working with our partners to make that a reality. https://t.co/1MYZL7EDdy

120 million people globally have been forcibly displaced by war, climate change, and disease.

At UNGA, I convened leaders to discuss the steps we must take to strengthen the humanitarian system, including supporting host countries, development efforts, and new technology usage. https://t.co/ZBTG9F508M

Today's @UN Summit of the Future was an opportunity to renew our collective commitment to the purpose and principles of the UN Charter, the Universal Declaration of Human Rights, and progress towards the Sustainable Development Goals. https://t.co/ApiHUcxVQU

The Atlantic Ocean links Atlantic nations through common opportunities and challenges.

At #UNGA, I reaffirmed the importance of our strong collaboration and knowledge sharing through the Atlantic Partnership to support sustainable blue economies. https://t.co/QjKoWpplbd

Productive meeting with officials from Italy, Germany, France, and the UK. We discussed the importance of achieving a ceasefire in Gaza, sustained support for Ukraine, and decisive action on Iran. We’re united in our commitment to these critical issues. https://t.co/hG6IGxrE2O

Met with French President @EmmanuelMacron in Paris today. I thanked him for his leadership on Ukraine’s defense in the face of Russia’s war of aggression. We also discussed the Israel-Hamas conflict including efforts to achieve a ceasefire and surge humanitarian aid for Gaza. https://t.co/Nir62FudCT

During my meeting with Foreign Minister @steph_sejourne, we discussed the conflict in Gaza, the need for continued coordination on humanitarian aid, and our commitment to Ukraine in the face of Russia’s ongoing war of aggression. https://t.co/p5KlXtWPmN

The @USEmbassyCairo team has shown incredible leadership and resilience during a critical and challenging time. Today I thanked them and their families for their hard work that has strengthened the U.S.-Egypt partnership. https://t.co/Vl45eHu1Za

Chaired the U.S.-Egypt Strategic Dialogue with Foreign Minister Abdelatty to further strengthen our broad and deep partnership. Whether its advancing trade, people-to-people ties, regional security, or human rights, it’s in our interests to keep doing this work together. https://t.co/zx9Y3ufcem

Met today with President @AlSisiOfficial and Foreign Minister Abdelatty. We reaffirmed our strong commitment to the U.S.-Egypt bilateral partnership and ongoing efforts to reach ceasefires in Gaza and Sudan. Grateful for Egypt’s continued regional leadership. https://t.co/LicQVRKkhs

Today, we made our new Online Passport Renewal system fully available to the public, a significant step forward in ensuring Americans can more easily access passport services. This online alternative is an important example of how we are modernizing government services.

Since we launched @WelcomeCorps more than 100,000 Americans from communities in all 50 states have answered the call to help thousands of refugees become our new neighbors. To all the sponsors who have helped find them homes, enroll in schools, and pursue their dreams: Thank you. https://t.co/J1SevfxbT2
We celebrate this International Day of Democracy with renewed determination to protect the rights and privileges that democracy provides and to continue our efforts to make them available to all.

Chef Ievgen Klopotenko has worked to ensure that the Ukrainian dish borsch is recognized globally as a vital part of Ukraine’s culture and identity. I’m impressed by Ievgen and Ukrainians like him who are fighting to preserve their rich traditions and protect their country. https://t.co/Cq2acKL5tU

The @USEmbassyWarsaw team has taken on a substantial burden as they've supported official travel in and out of Ukraine – a challenge they have more than met. Their work has strengthened our partnership and made us all more secure. https://t.co/Iw4MTxPlDW

During my meetings with President Duda, Prime Minister Tusk, and Foreign Minister Sikorski, we again made clear that the U.S. and Poland stand united as NATO Allies in support of Ukraine in the face of Russia’s aggression. Our relationship with Poland has never been stronger. https://t.co/wecPzPaIj5

The United States expresses our sincere condolences to the people of Vietnam and other nations in the region who have been impacted by Typhoon Yagi. To support relief efforts, we are providing immediate humanitarian aid to our Vietnamese partners through @USAID.

Spoke with Ukrainian civil society groups in Kyiv to hear how they continue to advocate for the values we share–democracy, human rights, and the rule of law–even in the face of Russia’s aggression. The U.S. is committed to helping strengthen Ukraine’s anti-corruption efforts. https://t.co/sQu03QGDTn

Crimea is Ukraine.

Crimea shows the future Putin seeks for all of Ukraine. It is not an isolated case — it is a blueprint.

At the Crimea Platform, I reiterated U.S. support for Ukraine's fight against Russia’s aggression. https://t.co/V5ZWWCYrDY

Today in Kyiv, I announced nearly $290 million in additional humanitarian assistance for the Ukrainian people. We continue to support Ukrainians whose lives have been shattered by this war and encourage additional donors to support the urgent humanitarian needs in Ukraine and the

Had an important discussion today with Ukraine’s Prime Minister @Denys_Shmyhal on Ukraine’s priorities in security, humanitarian assistance, and economic recovery. We look forward to helping Ukraine protect and repair its power grid. https://t.co/igXWodnK0T

Together with our UK Ally, the United States continues our enduring support for Ukraine and its territorial integrity. In our meeting with Ukrainian President @ZelenskyyUA today, we reiterated that we stand with Ukraine today, tomorrow, and for as long as it takes. https://t.co/ZxXUS3PijF

Had a constructive conversation with Ukrainian Foreign Minister @andrii_sybiha. U.S. and UK support for Ukraine’s defense against Russia’s aggression is ironclad. We look forward to close cooperation in the days ahead to protect Ukraine's sovereignty and support its recovery. https://t.co/ezwOKNQLEq

Today we honor the memories of the nearly 3,000 lives lost in the September 11 terrorist attacks. Their bravery and courage remind us of the resilience, sacrifice, and enduring strength that defines our nation and drives our ongoing fight against terrorism.

Iran’s provision of ballistic missiles in direct support of Russia’s war against Ukraine is a threat to European and global security. Today, @StateDept and @USTreasury are imposing sanctions on individuals and entities supporting such activities.

I met with UK Prime Minister @Keir_Starmer, underscoring the fundamental importance of our Special Relationship. The partnership between our two countries is critical to addressing today’s most pressing global challenges. https://t.co/PSu2UbuuQk

The U.S.-UK Strategic Dialogue symbolizes the strength of our relationship and is an opportunity to discuss cooperation on pressing geopolitical issues and shared interests. Thank you @DavidLammy for the productive conversation. https://t.co/RLsgG65lH1

In my meeting with UK Foreign Secretary @DavidLammy, we discussed the importance of the U.S.-UK relationship as we stand united to resolve the critical issues of our time. We also discussed our commitment to supporting Ukraine and the need to reach a ceasefire in Gaza. https://t.co/JrWZWysoth

Venezuelans voted for change. Maduro’s post-election repression has killed or jailed thousands, and winning candidate @EdmundoGU remains the best hope for democracy. We must not let Maduro and his representatives cling to power by force. The will of the people must be respected.

I spoke with Ukraine's new Foreign Minister @andrii_sybiha. He is a longtime partner and I'm confident we will continue the good work and close collaboration established by his predecessor. I look forward to seeing him in person in the weeks ahead.

Today the U.S. is providing another package of urgently needed weapons and equipment to help Ukraine defend its territory and its people against Russia’s ongoing attacks. The U.S. and the international coalition we have assembled continue to stand with Ukraine.

Enjoyed meeting students at El Dominco's English Immersion Program, where they are learning English with the help of @StateDept's language resources. English can be a social and economic ladder for many Dominicans, and we are dedicated to helping them achieve their aspirations. https://t.co/qQ0QdqSl25
Thank you President @LuisAbinader for your warm welcome to the Dominican Republic. Our friendship, alliance, and partnership has never been stronger. https://t.co/nGAwLD0JwK

With so many areas in which the United States and the Dominican Republic have shared interests, the team at @EmbajadaUSAenRD works diligently to ensure the partnership between our two countries remains strong and collaborative. Great to thank them in person today. https://t.co/rdQbpwyUrm

I visited Haiti at a moment of real challenge, but also at a moment of hope.

The U.S. is committed to Haiti and showing the Haitian people that we are here to support Haiti as it gets on the path to a better, more prosperous, and more secure future. https://t.co/kKga0Jb8BI

Toured the Multinational Security Support mission facilities with @MSSMHaiti Force Commander General Otunge and @pnh_officiel Director General Rameau. With new equipment and resources, this coordination hub will scale up activities to help restore peace and security for Haitians. https://t.co/2fEnD0fuEU

I had the opportunity to meet with our dedicated team at @USEmbassyHaiti. Everyday, they work to strengthen the U.S.-Haiti relationship so our two nations can share the advantages of a more secure and democratic partnership. https://t.co/tOGk81iRYf

Today, Haitian interim Prime Minister @ConilleGarry and I discussed next steps to improve security for the Haitian people, including supporting the success of the MSS mission and ensuring the Haitian people can democratically elect their leaders. https://t.co/zGGbvGobBq

I met with Haitian Transitional Presidential Council head @EdgardLeblanc to discuss critical work being done to advance election preparations. The Council's efforts are crucial to ensuring the Haitian people can choose their leaders and to restore democratic governance in Haiti. https://t.co/tVKl7mpxyL

The United States secured the release of 135 political prisoners from Nicaragua. We thank President @BArevalodeLeon for welcoming them to Guatemala. Nicaraguans deserve democracy and freedom from persecution in their home country.

Today I spoke with Foreign Minister @DmytroKuleba to thank him for his principled leadership of Ukraine’s foreign policy. The United States will continue our enduring support to Ukraine in the face of Russia’s brutal aggression.

For the @StateDept to continue to lead with diplomacy, we have to make sure we’re not only attracting, but retaining the best possible workforce. Today I shared with our amazing team our strategy to help keep our talent, so we can best deliver for the American people. https://t.co/NzUqBPci9E

On International Day of the Victims of Enforced Disappearances, we remember and stand with the victims and survivors of enforced disappearance and their families. We call upon governments to put an end to this egregious practice and respect human rights.

Wishing our talented squad of Paralympic athletes the best of luck as they compete in the #Paris2024 games! Excited to follow along as they represent our country and set new Paralympic and world records. Let's keep that #TeamUSA medal streak going!

The U.S. welcomes recent agreements to resume humanitarian access across the Adré border and along the Dabbah Road, allowing lifesaving aid to reach millions of Sudanese. We will keep working with our partners to further expand and accelerate emergency aid deliveries in Sudan.

Today marks the seventh anniversary of the Burma military’s genocide and crimes against humanity targeting Rohingya. The United States continues to honor the victims and stand with the survivors as they seek justice and accountability for these atrocities.

As the people of Ukraine celebrate 33 years of independence, we applaud their determination and sacrifice in defense of their sovereignty and freedom.

Their courage is unwavering in the face of Russia’s aggression.

We and our G7 partners stand with Ukraine, today, and always. https://t.co/vYe7C6kMjI

The U.S. is sending a new package of urgently needed weapons and equipment to support Ukraine's military forces as they defend against Russia’s ongoing attacks. This support will help Ukraine protect its troops, its people, and reinforce its capabilities on the front lines.

Ukraine’s flag flies over the memorials of those lost during Russia's brutal war. It represents the courage and sacrifice of those lost in years of battle, and the pride and unity of the Ukrainian people who continue to fight to write their own futures. Slava Ukraini. https://t.co/cijpO9iAJB

Today as the international community remembers those who have faced acts of violence because of their religion or beliefs, we honor the memories of those lost. The U.S. is unwavering in our commitment to freedom of religion or belief for everyone, everywhere.

I spoke with Qatari Amir Sheikh Tamim bin Hamad Al Thani and discussed ongoing efforts to negotiate a ceasefire agreement that would alleviate the suffering of the Palestinian people and secure the release of the hostages to return to their families.

Today I spoke with Qatari Prime Minister @MBA_AlThani_ to discuss efforts to finalize negotiations for a ceasefire in Gaza. I thanked the Prime Minister for Qatar’s vital role in mediating negotiations and promoting regional peace. https://t.co/aQIJfS1o7Y

Met with Egypt’s Foreign Minister Abdelatty today. I thanked him for Egypt’s efforts to secure an immediate ceasefire, release of all hostages, and essential humanitarian assistance. We also agreed to continue our close coordination on finding a path for peace in Sudan. https://t.co/xS6D1qS9Cg
Today, I met with Egypt’s President @AlSisiOfficial to discuss the strong U.S.-Egypt bilateral partnership and ongoing efforts to reach a ceasefire in Gaza. https://t.co/5k9NjeFusf

Met with @IsraeliPM Netanyahu to discuss efforts to de-escalate tensions and reach an agreement on the ceasefire and hostage release deal. I reaffirmed our ironclad commitment to Israel’s security and discussed how any escalation is in no party’s interest. https://t.co/nitptDlnmF

Met with Israeli officials @Isaac_Herzog and @yoavgallant to reiterate the urgent need to reach a ceasefire in Gaza that secures the release of hostages, allows a surge of humanitarian assistance, and creates the conditions for broader regional stability. https://t.co/iqNXNWKT0H

Congratulations to Prime Minister Paetongtarn on her selection as Thailand’s next prime minister. We look forward to engaging with Prime Minister Paetongtarn to further strengthen the enduring alliance between the United States and Thailand.

.@JPN_PMO Kishida and @POTUS took the U.S.-Japan Alliance to new heights as a truly global partnership. I witnessed his leadership firsthand as our countries advanced our shared vision for a more secure and prosperous Indo-Pacific region and world. https://t.co/R6ppFGhfuA

Austin Tice was taken captive 12 years ago. We call on the Syrian government to work with the United States to end Austin’s captivity and to provide an accounting for the fate of other Americans who went missing in Syria.

Today we commemorate the 75th Anniversary of the Geneva Conventions of 1949. The United States reaffirms our steadfast commitment to respecting international humanitarian law and mitigating suffering in armed conflict. We call on others to do the same.

Way to get it done at the #ParisOlympic Games @TeamUSA!

You are an inspiration, and your nation couldn’t be prouder. I’m ready for many more medals to come from Team USA at #ParisParalympics in a few days.

In this fast-paced world, science and technology are essential components of U.S. foreign policy. As scientists working at @StateDept, the @NASEMJefferson professional fellows are enhancing our capacity to make science-informed decisions in our diplomacy. https://t.co/W0KlnaKglI

I welcome the swearing in of Dr. Muhammad Yunus to lead the interim government in Bangladesh. The United States supports his call for calm and peace and remains committed to working with Bangladesh as it charts a democratic and prosperous future the people in Bangladesh.

Joined @FSIatState Director Brewer in welcoming the @StateDept's newest civil service and foreign service employees today. They embody the tremendous time and effort we've put into building the foundation of the future of American diplomacy: our people. https://t.co/W1WH59sSa5
We’re sending Ukraine a significant new package of urgently needed munitions. This support will help Ukraine protect its troops and its people and reinforce its capabilities across the front lines.

At the State Department, we must not only keep up with an ever-changing world, but keep ahead. I visited @FSIatState to see the innovative training and resources designed to help our diplomats meet the challenges of the 21st century. https://t.co/JaO7Z1gCOl

The U.S.-Australia alliance is an anchor to peace and prosperity in the Indo-Pacific and globally.

Deepening our cooperation across the pillars of our alliance – security, economic, climate, clean energy – has been the hallmark of the Australia-U.S. Ministerial Consultations. https://t.co/Y1r5RbflGo

Today marks 16 years since Russia’s invasion of Georgia. We remember those killed and displaced and call on Russia to withdraw its forces to pre-conflict positions. The U.S. is committed to supporting Georgia’s sovereignty and territorial integrity.

Today, we mark the 26th anniversary of the bombings of @USEmbassyKenya and @USEmbassyTZ. The passage of time does not diminish the memory of those killed in this horrific terrorist attack. We also honor the courage and resilience of the first responders on that tragic day.

Today, Australian Foreign Minister @SenatorWong and I signed a memorandum of understanding to coordinate our efforts on countering foreign information manipulation. We discussed cooperation in the Indo-Pacific and our joint work on critical minerals, climate, and energy. https://t.co/6jLuucvBmg

When @POTUS took office, he instructed us to transform our approach to the Indo-Pacific. Under his leadership, we’ve rebuilt bridges among our allies and partners – which is making America and our neighbors safer and stronger. https://t.co/dGyjpsdwWm

As @UnderSecPD, Liz Allen has embodied a fundamental truth of our work: that public diplomacy is central to every foreign policy priority and foundational to U.S. global leadership. Today, as she leaves this role, we thank her for her leadership and her service. https://t.co/hMJROVTXm5

On this day 80 years ago, over 4,200 Roma were murdered at Auschwitz-Birkenau. Today, we honor them and call on governments to work for the fullest possible documentation of the Roma genocide and to protect Roma rights.

Electoral data overwhelmingly demonstrate the will of the Venezuelan people: democratic opposition candidate @EdmundoGU won the most votes in Sunday’s election. Venezuelans have voted, and their votes must count.

I got the chance to speak with Evan, Paul, and Alsu on their way home to the United States today.

We couldn’t be happier to welcome them back home to be with their families again. https://t.co/gRE6mpN3Te

Met with Prime Minister @OyunerdeneMN today to discuss how the United States and Mongolia can deepen our partnership by expanding economic and people-to-people ties, including through English language programs for the people of Mongolia. https://t.co/eWuf9U37XN

Met today with Mongolian President @UKhurelsukh to reaffirm the significance of the U.S.-Mongolia Strategic Partnership and discuss U.S. commitment as a proud “Third Neighbor” of Mongolia. https://t.co/4eNk51UTUO

Paul Whelan, Evan Gershkovich, and Alsu Kurmasheva are on their way to the United States to reunite with their families. I’m grateful for all of those who worked to secure their freedom and for our allies and partners who made this deal possible.

Had the opportunity to meet the dedicated team at @usembmongolia today. Our support of Mongolia as a “third neighbor” is built on the incredible work by the embassy to grow our two countries’ economic, education, arts, and military cooperation. https://t.co/sNJyTywyiJ

Renewing, reinvigorating, and in some cases reimagining our alliances and partnerships has been a critical part of our efforts from day one. The United States sees multilateral institutions as an integral part of our engagement around the world. https://t.co/bwwxmLHqCm

Some of my favorite stops on trips are when I get to meet with our Embassy teams and thank them for their work. Grateful to the @USEmbassySG team for their work every day to strengthen our partnership with Singapore. https://t.co/BbM45TVKto

From AI to biotechnology, Singapore is an important partner to the U.S. when it comes to critical and emerging technologies. By joining efforts and capitalizing on our collective strengths, we can speed innovation to create solutions to the world’s most pressing problems. https://t.co/WSnsZHIcoK

After a comprehensive review of our bilateral cooperation due to anti-democratic actions by the Georgian government, we are pausing $95 million in assistance that benefits the Government of Georgia. We remain committed to the Georgian people and their Euro-Atlantic aspirations.

I met with Senior Minister @leehsienloong and congratulated him on his 20-year tenure as Singapore's Prime Minister. We discussed the importance of bolstering our security and economic ties for our countries, the region, and the world. https://t.co/YQlYdIvbox

I met with Singaporean Prime Minister @LawrenceWongST today to underscore the importance of the U.S.-Singapore strategic partnership and the role it plays in upholding international norms and standards around the world. We remain committed to strengthening our shared ties. https://t.co/awU119DNdA

Today I signed a 123 Agreement on civil nuclear cooperation with Singapore. In addition to deepening our energy partnership with Singapore, they will also join our FIRST program to build capabilities to further explore clean, secure, and safe nuclear energy. https://t.co/0nQgxIcy1r

Welcomed meeting with Singaporean Foreign Minister @VivianBala. We reaffirmed the strong U.S.-Singapore strategic partnership, our enduring commitment to the Indo-Pacific, and our many areas of cooperation on regional and global challenges and opportunities. https://t.co/SFNzcJpeKz

At the end of my visit to Manila, I got the chance to stop by @AuroChocolate Cafe and talk with owner Mark Ocampo. We talked about their work to uplift local farmers, and I of course got to try some of their delicious chocolate. https://t.co/BvlIuSDrJd

After meeting with our counterparts in Tokyo, @SecDef Austin and I headed to Manila to meet with @SecManalo and @dndphl Secretary Teodoro Jr.

Through our 2+2 Ministerial Dialogue, we talk directly with partners about ways we can address the biggest challenges and opportunities https://t.co/r41EspTrWK

.@SecDef Austin and I met with Philippine President Marcos to discuss the Indo-Pacific and our commitment to the U.S.-Philippines Alliance. Through increased investments, new cyber and economic dialogues, and nuclear energy cooperation, we continue to advance our shared https://t.co/RWGgFRnaFY

RT @SecDef: It’s great to be in Manila with @SecBlinken for the fourth U.S.-Philippines 2+2 Ministerial Dialogue.

Across the ocean floor, undersea cables carry more than 95% of the world’s digital traffic.

We’re working with Indo-Pacific partners, like Japan, and private companies, like @NEC, to connect people across the region and ensure the security of this infrastructure. https://t.co/fl7Z4sD37e

We’re sending Ukraine a significant new package of urgently needed munitions. This is the ninth security assistance package @POTUS has authorized to help Ukraine since signing the Ukraine Security Supplemental Appropriations Act.

Japanese Prime Minister Kishida, @SecDef Austin, and I discussed the  progress we have made on our defense commitments through our Security 2+2 consultations. The success of these ongoing efforts is a testament to the strength of the U.S.-Japan Alliance. https://t.co/LR9NASJ3IL

The Quad is committed to improving the lives of people across the Indo-Pacific region and beyond. From increasing maritime domain awareness to helping the region prevent cyber attacks, we are investing in the region’s success. https://t.co/4KSoNvGhvI

Today, @SecDef Austin and I met with Japanese Foreign Minister Kamikawa and Defense Minister Kihara. We reaffirmed the United States’ commitment to deepen defense industry and technology cooperation and discussed ways to implement strategic initiatives for our important Alliance. https://t.co/78pL4YlfUG

In my meeting with Japanese Foreign Minister Kamikawa I discussed the significance of the U.S.-Japan Alliance and its impact on the security and prosperity of the Indo-Pacific region. https://t.co/DWJnilSCaO
Met with Indian External Affairs Minister @DrSJaishankar to deepen U.S.-India collaboration and affirm our shared commitment to regional peace, security, and prosperity. https://t.co/sHSSH3uTtq

Our commitment to supporting a strong, independent, prosperous, and resilient Vietnam is unwavering. I expressed my condolences on General Secretary Nguyễn Phú Trọng's passing to Vietnamese @FMBuiThanhSon and reiterated the strength of our Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. https://t.co/BUd4npsqJD

Vietnamese President To Lam and I met in Hanoi today to mark the loss of General Secretary Nguyễn Phú Trọng. We further discussed how our nations can continue to fulfill the aims of the U.S.-Vietnam Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. https://t.co/1BLs9mjCZq

In my meeting with Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh, we discussed our progress implementing the U.S.-Vietnam Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. The United States remains committed to working with Vietnam to advance our shared vision for a free and open Indo-Pacific. https://t.co/a22Xv1Qsop

In Hanoi today, I paid my respects to General Secretary Nguyễn Phú Trọng, mourning with thousands of others impacted by his passing. The United States has the utmost gratitude for his 13-year leadership of Vietnam and his commitment to shaping our U.S.-Vietnam friendship. https://t.co/mckztwoE4q

.@ASEAN is at the heart of the U.S. Indo-Pacific Strategy that addresses the region's biggest political and security challenges.

Joined 26 of my counterparts to discuss maritime issues, the South China Sea, the crisis in Burma, and more at today’s ASEAN Regional Forum. https://t.co/6w0E07tfpf

Today’s Mekong-U.S. Partnership Foreign Ministers’ Meeting reaffirmed our shared commitment to the sustainable development of the sub-region. We look forward to strengthening cooperation with our Mekong partners on new opportunities and key challenges impacting all our people. https://t.co/zxAfDO2Kzk

Met with PRC Director and Foreign Minister Wang Yi for a productive discussion about areas of difference and areas of cooperation. It is critical we responsibly manage competition between the United States and PRC while advancing U.S. interests and values. https://t.co/8V2Frf069P

Welcomed the opportunity to speak with Secretary-General of ASEAN @Hourn_Kao today in Vientiane. We discussed ways we can continue to implement the critical ASEAN-U.S. Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. https://t.co/VU9J4XDRW6
Through @ASEAN’s leadership, a free and open Indo-Pacific will help ensure security and prosperity among all across Southeast Asia. https://t.co/wuF5bRUjwe

Met with Foreign Minister Saleumxay Kommasith today and reaffirmed the United States' support for Laos’ @ASEAN chair year. We also discussed the importance of strengthening the U.S.-Lao Comprehensive Partnership. https://t.co/wbaCzCF50g
Wishing all of our amazing @TeamUSA athletes the best of luck at the #Paris2024 Olympic Games. A proud nation is looking forward to watching you shine.

Joined @POTUS to meet with @IsraeliPM Netanyahu at the White House. The President emphasized the need to close the remaining gaps on the ceasefire and hostage release deal as soon as possible to bring the hostages come home and alleviate the suffering of Palestinians in Gaza.
